PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Charge dissociation probability was characterized by photogenerated current density ( J ph ) vs effective applied voltage ( V eff ) measurements.

Let's think step by step.

1. Charge dissociation probability: This is a probability value that describes the likelihood of charge dissociation occurring.
2. Photogenerated current density (J ph): This is a measure of the amount of electric current generated by light. It is a value with units of current density (A/cm²).
3. Effective applied voltage (V eff): This is the voltage that is effective in producing a response in the system. It is a value with units of volts.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Charge dissociation probability: This is a material property that describes the likelihood of charge dissociation occurring.
2. Photogenerated current density (J ph): This is a material property that describes the amount of electric current generated by light per unit area. It is a value with units of current density (A/cm²).

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| --- |
| Charge dissociation probability |
| Photogenerated current density (J ph) |
